LanguageData.Alzheimers.label: alzheimer's
LanguageData.Alzheimers.description: A brain disease usually associated with aging. Alzheimer's disease causes progressive degradation in the ability to think and remember. Patients are known to forget close relatives and sometimes wander around in confusion.
LanguageData.Alzheimers.stages.minor-0.label: minor
LanguageData.Alzheimers.stages.minor-1.label: minor
LanguageData.Alzheimers.stages.major-0.label: major
LanguageData.Alzheimers.stages.major-1.label: major
LanguageData.Asthma.label: asthma
LanguageData.Asthma.description: A long-term inflammatory disease of the airways in the lungs. It requires regular tending to prevent symptoms.
LanguageData.Asthma.stages.minor.label: minor
LanguageData.Asthma.stages.major-0.label: major
LanguageData.Asthma.stages.major-1.label: major
LanguageData.BadBack.label: bad back
LanguageData.BadBack.description: Degradation in the spinal column and surrounding musculature. This makes it hard to move and bend smoothly.
LanguageData.Blindness.label: blindness
LanguageData.Carcinoma.label: carcinoma
LanguageData.Carcinoma.description: A lump of cancerous tissue. Without treatment, the carcinoma will grow over time, causing worsening symptoms and eventually killing the patient.\n\nA skilled doctor can excise the carcinoma. An unskilled doctor may be able to simply amputate the body part which contains the carcinoma.
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.minor-0.label: minor
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.minor-1.label: minor
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.major-0.label: major
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.major-1.label: major
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.extreme-0.label: extreme
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.extreme-1.label: extreme
LanguageData.Cataract.label: cataract
LanguageData.Cataract.description: Milky-looking opacity in the eye. Cataracts impair vision.
LanguageData.Dementia.label: dementia
LanguageData.Dementia.description: Neural degradation which causes deficits in the ability to think and remember. Dementia has various causes including aging, specific illnesses, and toxins.
LanguageData.Frail.label: frail
LanguageData.Frail.description: Generalized loss of muscle and bone density.
LanguageData.HearingLoss.label: hearing loss
LanguageData.HearingLoss.description: Inability to hear quiet sounds due to degradation of hair cells in the cochlea.
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.label: artery blockage
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.description: A blockage in one of the critical arteries in the heart. Heart artery blockages randomly induce heart attacks.
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.stages.minor-0.label: minor
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.stages.minor-1.label: minor
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.stages.major-0.label: major
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.stages.major-1.label: major
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.stages.extreme.label: extreme
LanguageData.OrganDecay.label: organ decay
LanguageData.OrganDecay.description: An untreatable degenerative disease affecting a single organ. The cause may be bacterial or viral. The illness seems to strike randomly from an unknown natural reservoir; it is not directly contagious between people.\n\nThis organ will slowly lose function before dying completely. Replace it with a bionic or natural organ.
LanguageData.OrganDecay.stages.minor.label: minor
LanguageData.OrganDecay.stages.moderate.label: moderate
LanguageData.OrganDecay.stages.severe.label: severe
LanguageData.OrganDecay.stages.extreme.label: extreme
